title: Requirement for Custom Decimal Precision in Deal Guidance
author: Vahhab Mumtaz Lakhani
content: The customer has a specific requirement regarding the deal guidance functionality. They need the ability to set different precision levels for decimal numbers displayed on the deal guidance screen, separate from the decimal precision used for values displayed in the cart. The customer wants to customize the precision for decimal numbers specifically for the deal guidance screen.

comments.content: Thank you for sharing your idea. We will consider this suggestion for future platform improvements.

title: Apply contract pricing irrespective of line item being cloned from an asset
author: John Hammons
content:
Present behavior is that when an asset is changed, and an option line item is cloned, contract pricing will not be applied unless the original option line item also has the contract applied. The behavior is as follows:
Perform a "change" operation on the asset.Re-configure the bundle, and clone an option line item.Apply contract to the new option line item. See no change in pricing, and contract price list item is not applied after repricing.Apply contract to the original line item. Contract price list item is then applied after repricing to the cloned line item. Original line item still retains it's own price list item due to asset pricing.
The ask is for the ability to apply contract pricing to the clone without having to apply the contract to the original line item.

comments.content: Hello,We will reach out to the creator of the Idea with some more questions on the use case and see what we can do.

title: Promotions: Apply benefits at the bundle level instead of cart level
author: Shiv Chorawala
content:
As of now, Conga CPQ at the cart level applies for benefits on the benefits (Product) Line Item whichever comes first based on the lowest Primary Line Number.
 
Below are two different scenarios explaining how promotions are applied as of now and how this is not helping one of our customer GEHC promotion use case.
 
Scenario - 1
On the Cart, if we have 2 bundles and both of them have the scope and the benefit. If we try applying incentives on both the scopes it applies benefit only once in the first bundle which has the lowest primary line number. The second bundle will never have the benefit applied even though the Promotion Scope & Benefit are present on both bundles.
 
Scenario - 2
On the Cart, if we have 2 bundles and both of them have the scope and the benefit. There is one benefit that is already applied to the first bundle. 
When we apply the promotion on the second bundle, we see that this promotion is not getting applied on the second bundle as there is a benefit that has already been applied on the first bundle
 
GEHC Business Use Case: 
The Customer needs the benefit to be applied on bundle level and not on the cart level.
The priority of assigning benefit products should be given to the bundle level first then to the cart level. But right now it applying on the cart level. 
 
Promotion design gives a 10% discount on upgrading laptop storage to 1 TB
Use case:
Example: - In the cart we have two Laptop configure
 

 
In my case, Just want to apply a Promotional discount to the second bundle/product (Dell XPS 14) -- but based on Scenario - 1 - the benefit is getting applied to the first benefit product that is, and the option/configure line of Bundle-1 (Dell Inspiron 5559). 
 
Please find the attachment under the idea which has sample data use cases.

title: Promotions: Promotion should apply to all nested bundle options
author: Shahid Ali
content:
If we apply promotion to nested bundle as a benefit, the promotion should get applied to all the option inside the nested bundle (better if this is a configurable setting). Currently we have done customization to apply benefit adjustment to all the nested option but too much customization with promotions is causing issues so a OOB solution is needed.
For customer use cases, the nested bundle will have zero List price so it should work with zero price as well.
Also, the removal of promotion from nested bundle should go and remove it from all the nested option.

title: HasIncentive and Incentive Code flag value in C# PCB (BasePriceCallback)
author: Shahid Ali
content:
The HasIncentive and Incentive Code lineitem fields for benefit line item are not available in all methods of Before Pricing of Base Price Call Back of Turbo C# PCB. Due to this, the customer(s) have to use additional customization in case of Turbo, as in Salesforce PCB, these fields are available with updated values in PCB. 
 
Ask: The HasIncentive and Incentive Code should be available in all methods in C# PCB methods in BasePriceCallabck.

title: setIncentivesForCart API: Incentive code should be applied on Benefits items too.
author: Shahid Ali
content: Currently, the Incentive Code is applied only to the Scope item in case of Buy X Get Y. When there are multiple instance of Y products available in cart, and OR condition is selected in Benefit criteria, Conga will apply the benefit to the item which has lowest primary line number. If the benefit item is nested bundle Customer has to use customization to apply promotion to all the option inside the nested bundle.

title: Promotions: Apply benefits only when benefit product is inside a bundle
author: Shahid Ali
content:
We need the option in promotions where we can define the benefit criteria to be bundle-option combination. This is somewhat similar to the ‘include bundle option’ available in scope of promotions.
 
Business Use Case: Customer wants to restrict the incentives to be applied only when a product is present as an option/nested option inside a particular bundle. The current behavior is to apply the incentive on the matching benefit product found in the cart, regardless of which bundle it is present in.

title: Promotions: Ability to fetch the benefit products using API
author: Shahid Ali
content:
We need the ability to pre-emptively get the benefit products from the cart which are eligible for as benefit products for promotions, particularly for Buy X Get Y type of promotions. Currently, the get incentives API only returns the eligible promotions which satisfy the scope criteria but there is a possibility that the product/option defined in benefits may not be present in the cart thereby making the promotion irrelevant for the cart. This will be needed for Turbo pricing as well
 
Business Use Case: GEHC has a custom UI screen where getincentives API is used to show eligible promotions. This API returns results based on scope and not benefit products. Users can apply a promotion after selection from available promotion based on API results but do not see ant effect on cart if benefit product is absent. This can cause confusion to users on incentives application.

title: Display cart currency symbol prefixed for the values on deal guidance screen
author: Pavan Kumar
content: Currently on the deal guidance screen, Currency values are displayed as Decimals only. It would be good to have an enhancement to show currency symbol prefixed to the values for better user experience.

title: Turbo Pricing: Need more validations from pricing APIs
author: Shahid Ali
content:
Currenlty there are limited validations from Turbo API for the data recieved in payload. There could be many scenarios in customer uses cases like add favourites through classic API, fast selection etc. where such data can be created on SDFC side which is not valid for Turbo pricing engine.
Some examples from a recent production case 00887371:
1) Line sequence field on item is zero
2) Price Line item attached in line item payload does not exist on Turbo DB.
 
ASK: There could be other use cases where key fields like line number, PLIs, item sequence, line sequence have corrupt data like duplicate lines, invalid values etc. Turbo APIs especially the restore/full api should be able to send appropiate error message as a part of response when such data is recieved so that customer can correct the data or handle it gracefully in their customization.

title: Related Pricing for Service CPQ
author: Jigar Naik
content: As we have the related pricing functionality for the standard CPQ setup, we should also have the similar mechanism for Service CPQ. We recently got a requirement for Hitachi Energy to price the service product as certain percentage of the asset it would be relate to. For example, when the asset “Cyber Security Workplace” is related to “Basic Service”, “Basic Service” should be priced as 2% of “Cyber Security Workplace” asset price.For the demo, we have met this requirement using the pricing callback but having an OOB feature for the same would be really helpful.

title: Support multiple contract numbers on Pricelist in contract pricing.
author: Shahid Ali
content:
As of today, a pricelist can have only one contract number in contract pricing. Customer currently uses contract price lists to store list price of their customer specific price. There is also a adjustment/discount component which is stored in a custom object (agreement product line item) and it is applied in PCB logic. So, in many cases multiple customers can use same list price (from contract price list) but the discount could be different. The admin team has to create and manage multiple contract price lists with same list price from same products which they have raise as a pain point.
 
Please reach out to me to get details.

title: Turbo Pricing: Need to handle WS close events gracefully
author: Shahid Ali
content:
With Turbo pricing on the OOB configuration page, we see an issue that the out of box web socket is closed. Mostly its with the Close code 1006. When this happens the carts gets stuck and the end user is clueless on why this cart is not working. We need a graceful exit when OOB web socket is closed for any reason. The user should see some message and the next action he can do to move forward. Since we do not have a handle OOB WS details are not able to handle this issue. Please provide a graceful exit to WS close scenarios from product end.
 
Please reach out to me/Shiv C. for any details

title: Need API to force reprice of cart on Conga Platform
author: Harsh Shah
content:
We have few customer requirements where every month the master data like Price rules/ Currency Rates etc will be modified by admin based on need and they want the existing carts to get reprice based on the latest data that is modified.
So we need an API which can be triggered for cart where even without modifying the pricing status of lines we can reprice entire cart so that pricing is fetched based on latest configuration.

title: Cart Grand Total for  Usage Products
author: Saumil Deodhar
content:
We have a problem related to Grand Total on the Usage Products use case.
 
We have a use case of spreading at Roche Diagnostics QTC where price of certain materials needed to support a diagnostic test provide a "spread" to the price of a test. In simple words, the price of a diagnostic test incorporates the price of needed materials and customer doesn't pay of materials but only pay to Roche per test.
 
Below example will provide simple explanation of above where Material 1-4 are providing a spread(specified in Surcharge column) to the Test Price. After receiving surcharge, the price of the test now includes price of the underlying materials.
 

 
Can product provide some setting where the Net Price of the usage product start getting included in the Grand Total of the shopping cart?
 
Currently, we would need to customise the total calculations.

content:

Presently, when a user overrides a price point with a new adjustment value, it is accurately displayed in the waterfall. However, the user is unable to access this value beyond the Price Waterfall. If a user intends to utilize this value in a different context, there is currently no mechanism to facilitate such an action.

title: Allow the user to remove default price points & discounts from the Price Waterfall Display.
author: Akshay Vaibhav
content:
Current Capability:

 
Presently, certain default points like Base Price Override, Group Adjustment, and Incentive are consistently visible to users. The user lacks the ability to control the visibility of these points, meaning they are always displayed when the criteria are met.
 
To be Capability:
Enable users to manage the visibility of default price points, including Base Price Override, Incentive, and Group Adjustment. Allow users to decide whether to present these points to the customer or keep them hidden.

title: Show waterfall data for secondary charge lines
author: Harsh Shah
content:
Currently on the waterfall page we are just showing Primary lines but we have use case for customer where all the pricing is going to roll up to multiple secondary charge lines and for specific set of users we will not show option lines. So users will just see charge lines with all rolled up pricing. For this scenario waterfall is not useful as users will not see any waterfall for secondary charge lines of bundle.
We would also want that Disable bundle option feature be implemented for waterfall page same as cart page so users who cannot expand bundle on cart page will also not see option lines for same bundle on waterfall page.

title: Allow Deal Guidance to be shown on Shopping cart
author: Swapnil Devlekar
content: Currently, the deal guidance is displayed at the line level, or it can be incorporated through formula fields at the Quote header level. When sales reps are engaged in negotiations within the shopping cart, it is more beneficial for them to have the comprehensive deal guidance visible directly in the shopping cart, eliminating the need to navigate away to the quote header

title: Allow custom deal guidance shapes/images
author: Swapnil Devlekar
content: Currently, the deal Guidance band does not allow to setup custom shapes or images. The current OOTB shapes are not easy to interpret. We should allow customers to set up customer images/shapes that are easy for Salesreps to understand.

title: Allow the user to choose any price point in “Adjustment Applies to” setting while configuring Price Pipeline Ruleset.
author: Akshay Vaibhav
content:
Current Capability:
Currently the user can only choose between List Price, Previous & Prior Price point while doing the configuration. 
 

If the user wants to choose a specific price point while defining the rule, there is no option to do so.
 
To be Capability:
Allow the user to choose any price point in “Adjustment Applies To” field including custom price points.
 

For example, if a user wants to define SG&A as a percentage of Invoice Price. The current functionality restricts the user.

title: Allow the user to choose the adjustment type while applying discount on Price Waterfall Page
author: Akshay Vaibhav
content:
Current Capability:

 
If we apply discount on the price waterfall page, we can only override using values. We can't choose between discount %, discount amount, markup amount and other discount types.
 
 
To be Capability:
Allow the user to choose between different adjustment types, so that they can accordingly apply on the Price Waterfall Page.

title: Control the sequence of manual adjustment applied through shopping cart in Price Waterfall
author: Akshay Vaibhav
content:
Current Capability:
 
When a user makes a manual adjustment via the shopping cart page, it is consistently applied after the Price Pipeline Ruleset points. If a user wishes to manage the sequence of applying manual adjustments, there is currently no option to do so.
 
To be Capability:
Enable users to specify the point at which a manual adjustment is incorporated. The current sequencing of manual adjustments results in variation in the final price calculation.

title: Allow users to show the value of custom price point in Grand Total
author: Akshay Vaibhav
content:
Current Capability:
Presently, in the pricing process, the Grand Total reflects the sum of Net Prices for all line items after calculation. However, when a custom price point is specified post Net Price calculation through a callback, Grand Total fails to consider the most recent price point after Net Price, displaying the outdated price instead.
Additionally, when applying a discount to the Total Price, the configuration of a custom price point hinders the ability to cascade the discount to individual line items.
 
To be Capability:
Enable users to display the cumulative value of Custom Price Points in the Grand Total when they have set up additional pricing points following the Net Price calculation. This adjustment will address the previously mentioned cascading issue.

comments.content: Unfortunately, we don't have an out-of-the-box feature capability to achieve the same, so will have to wait for the Total level waterfall.

Until the Total Level Waterfall is developed. Can we have a way to show the custom price point in the Grand Total, so that there is no mismatch between the actual value and the value shown in Grand Total which is sum of Net Prices for all Line Items

We will solve the ask with Total level waterfall (https://conga.atlassian.net/browse/CPQ-77408). With Total level waterfall, we can calculate all the price points before and after the net price.Closing the idea.

title: Allow the user to change the label of List Price in Price Pipeline.
author: Akshay Vaibhav
content:
Current Capability:
In the current functionality, if a user configures a Price Pipeline to configure a Price Waterfall, they can’t change the label of List Price and Base Price. Due to this if we need the List Price and Base Price points with different names as per the use case, it can’t be implemented. 
 

 

 
To be Capability:
Allow the user to edit the name of List Price and Base Price pricing points, so that user can customize the waterfall as per the use case.

title: Turbo: Ability to delete C# PCB logs from swagger

When we price a cart multiple times while testing/debugging, a lot of logs are generated and Swaager UI becomes cluttered. We can get a limited number of logs on screen and it becomes difficult to scroll/navigate.

title: Turbo: Enable logs for different users in Swagger.
author: Shahid Ali
content: Currently in Turbo the logs for PCB and Pricing execution are enabled only for the user whose security token is used for login. Admin user should be able to enable debug logs in swagger for other users (similar to what we have in Salesforce debug logs). This is needed when a Turbo error comes in production and UAT environments where actual business users cannot share their security token due to security reasons.

title: Turbo Pricing: Getting code line numbers in debug logs should not be depended on UI exception feature flag.
author: Shahid Ali
content:
In order to get line number from C# PCB code we were provided the below API.
 
https://<tenant-name-here>.congacloud.com/pricing/api/admin/swagger/index.html
 
As of today, this feature The feature will not work if flag is-callback-exception-throw-enabled is true. You have to turn this flag off. We want the limitation to be reomved and the debuglog API should work even when the flag is true.
 
The feature flag is-callback-exception-throw-enabled enabled the exceptions on UI which is needed otherwise there is no indication that error has occurred except in UI/logs. In production we can keep it off but in dev/QA environment it is needed to make both of them together.

title: Turbo Data Sync: Use Bulk API 2.0
author: Shahid Ali
content: We got an error in data sync where data sync was consumed all the bulk API limit in the org which was blocking other integrations to work (JIRA CPQ-59318). On investigation we found that bulk API batches with 0 records were being created. We also connected with Salesforce.com and they recommended to use Bulk API 2.0 for data sync application. Please use Bulk API 2.0 as per recommendation

title: Turbo Data Sync: Dependency Sync should start only on data change
author: Shahid Ali
content:
Currently the data sync system syncs the dependent objects even when there is no releavant change in the master object to be synced. For Example, If there is a Field 'A' on Product2 object and it is updated on 10k product2 records, the system will start syncing all dependent objects like PriceListItems (PLI) even if this field is not used in any formula fields. This behaviour is causing issues with customers with huge data volume, e.g. for GEHC 180k products update triggered sync on 2.5 million PLIs even though there were no fields on PLI which were require to be updated.
 
Since we already have metadata info, Can we make the sync smarter to make sure the dependecy sync is triggered only when we have to update something on child records. Relying on ‘Last modified Date’ only might again trigger such un-necessary dependecy syncs in future so having this enhancement will help us avoid issues in the future.

comments.content: Shahid, the system will check whether any PLI records were changed and in your case, since no records changed, data-sync will ignore that object and move on. Is that not what you are seeing?

title: Ability to show an indication on the cart line item when pricing status returns an error from turbo call back
author: Swapnil Bhandarkar
content:
Hi, the field Apttus_Config2__PricingStatus__c in the line item object (Apttus_Config2__LineItem__c) is an open picklist with 2 valid values (Complete and Pending). When pricing status is pending, there is a icon on the line item on the cart for showing that price is pending.
In turbo pricing, when we use turbo callback to fetch the pricing (by connecting to an external system) and whenever there is an error in pricing, then the value is set to 'Error' (as it is not a restricted picklist).
Currently, when this pricing status is set to 'Error', there is no status etc shown on the cart for identifying that there was something wrong with the pricing or even which line item had a pricing error. The expectation is to show some symbol/icon to let the user know that there was a pricing error.
 
PS: We have setup a custom message on the cart when there is a pricing error. But there is a bug on that for which we have raised a TS Case. But with this idea, the expectation is that there should be an ability to show a icon whenever there pricing status = 'Error'.

comments.content: Issues faced by the user:a) There is no UI indicator for the user on the screen when Pricing status is marked as Error.b) In case of new line addition PLI is not associated, however in case of reprice there is no way user knows the pricing hasn’t happened. c) If PLI has been associated and further Quantity changes from 1 to 2. User still sees the price of 1 product after Reprice operation.

title: Cost Context in Turbo
author: Nilay Desai
content:
We have one issue with the execution of the Presto Callback and Pricing Callback. The current execution is as follows:
Cost Model associated to pricelist.Presto Callback is invoked – costing is calculated.Pricing Callback is invoked.
Hitachi Energy now has cost and price information coming in via an Integration with SAP REIWA. In this scenario, there are two challenges:
Presto Callback has already executed – with no control to execute is after pricing has happened.Cost Line Items are not accessible in the Pricing Callback.
With these limitations we do not have a way to get cost calculated.
We cannot build this integration from Presto Callback because not all pricelists using costing approach and hence presto is not invoked in all transactions. To build a solution where call is invoked from Turbo PCB and Presto Callback basis the cost model association is a very expensive way to build any Integration – as we have to replicate authentication, authorization, parsing, error handling & logging framework on both Turbo and SFDC side as there is no reusability possible between the two. 
 
We need a capability to have Cost Data available in Turbo context and further some cost ruleset feature for cost engine.

title: Incentive / Promotion - Display the Benefit Quantity as a distinct line item on the shopping cart
author: Tushar Sonawane
content:
Currently, the benefit quantity is included in the Incentive/Promotion section but is concealed within the adjustment line item. It would be beneficial to have the benefit quantity displayed as a separate line on the shopping cart, allowing end users to see it and including it on generated documents.
These types of promotions are particularly applicable to the FMCG and pharmaceutical industries, where promotions often involve receiving an additional product rather than a discounted price. Although such promotions may appear to be limited to B2C scenarios, they are also present in B2B.
As part of this concept, several features could be incorporated, such as:
1) Automatically adding a benefit product to the shopping cart, even if it has not or already been added
2) Removing the benefit quantity line if the item on which the promotion was applied is removed from the shopping cart
3) Making the benefit quantity line read-only (in case added as a sperate line)
4) Clearly marking the product line with a different color or icon to indicate that it has been automatically added as part of the promotion
5) Including the benefit quantity as a free quantity, meaning that there is no pricing impact
Suggestion: It may be more challenging to apply this idea to complex bundle products, so it could be limited to the standalone items.

title: API to return progress result from pricing queueable jobs to display pricing progress.
author: Irfan Khan
content:
Conga has an API which returns the progress result of pricing operation. This API gives the percentage completion details of the batch job that is being run with the async pricing in progress. It has no direct linkage to the number of line items getting priced. The % complete indicates the % of jobs completed, not the % of priced items. This is a very generic job monitoring API that is meant to display a busy indicator rather than an accurate measure of the task.
 
What is expected here is the 'no of jobs completed' and 'Total no of jobs' as a result of this API. As we know that how many items are there and what is the pricing batch size, so we can easily calculate the both results. 
 
Eg. - 100 items are there which are pending, and batch size is 5 then 100/5 = 20 will be the 'Total no of jobs' submitted in back end. When 'Compute total in separate steps' checkbox is checked then we can increase the Total no of jobs with 1. So it will be 21 .
 
It is very general calculation similar to it happens in batch process. Similar thing can be implement in this new API.

title: Auto save functionality on cart is not available in CPQ
author: Swapnil Bhandarkar
content:
Currently, In quotations when we are configuring products and when line item is added and/or changes are made etc, then we can save the cart only on button click on the cart.
Can this be autosaved. Meaning every time we make some changes to the configuration, there will be periodically changes saved automatically without user needing to manually save it.

comments.content: Auto Save functionality can be implemented through triggers, although the standard behavior will remain unchanged to avoid any adverse effects on existing customers. Introducing customization could potentially impact performance. However, on the Conga platform, auto-saving will always be enabled.

title: Custom CSS for Custom Fieldsfrom Display Column Settings

title: Turbo Pricing - Addition of new field in Product2 object should not require manual clearance of cache
author: Mohit Patel
content: Turbo Pricing - Currently addition of new field in Product2 object need manual intervention in form of cache clearance. If we add new field and don't perform this manual step then new field don't show immediately in the turbo response until and unless the API Cache is deleted. In absence of system guided or automatic clearing approach, it is likely to be missed out by project/support team during execution and that leads to unnecessary down times and blocker issues in production. Hence need Out of the box solution to avoid such issues.

title: Async Pricing: Provide error handling mechanism for async pricing API - Apttus_Config2.BatchJobService.updatePriceForCart
author: Vaibhav Kothari
content:
Use Case: Salesforce is evaluating queueable async pricing API Apttus_Config2.BatchJobService.updatePriceForCart to work with larger carts. This API works fine but it only returns the Job Id as a response.
https://documentation.conga.com/cpq/september-22/updating-price-for-the-smart-cart-143197743.html
 
Since Salesforce is going to call the API from a custom page, they would like to know whether the API execution is successful or failed. At present, there is an email that goes to the submitter about the job completion. No other monitoring mechanism is available.
 
Ask: To have a monitoring framework for async pricing job. Since these are queueable jobs, there are multiple chained jobs as per the pricing batch size.
 
Impact: Salesforce cannot leverage async pricing API unless there is a mechanism to monitor the jobs.

title: Async Pricing (RepriceCartJob API) : Flexibility to modify the email going out to the submitter for success or failure of the job
author: Vaibhav Kothari
content:
Salesforce is currently using RepriceCartJob API to submit async approvals for carts with more line items. An email is sent to the submitter when the job is completed. As of now, there is no configurable email template for this API and the email content is very minimal/technical.
 
Ask: Salesforce would like to have separate email templates for success/failure scenarios of this job so that they can customize the email sent out to the submitter.
 
APTS_DisableCartAsyncNotification admin entry is available to disable email notifications but it is not specific to any API. It will disable emails for other async operations as well.
 
Impact: User does not get any details about the failure and next steps to be performed on the failed quote. Salesforce has custom implementation so they would like to notify the users about the next steps to be taken in case of such failures.

title: Stop/Customize email for "RepriceCartJob" API
author: Vaibhav Kothari
content:
Use Case: Salesforce is one of our largest enterprise customers and have a lot of custom UI implementation in CPQ flow. They call our APIs for pricing and have been running into CPU timeout errors for a cart with close to 70 line items. We proposed the solution to use async pricing by using "RepriceCartJob" API

https://documentation.conga.com/cpq/latest/repricing-the-cart-143903106.html


Issue: "RepriceCartJob" API works well for pricing the cart. However, the email received after the job completion is having very minimal information. It is one liner email saying that the batch job is completed.

There seems to be no email template behind this email and hence customers cannot customize the email going out to the users submitting a cart for async pricing.


Product team also recommended another API (BatchJobService.updatePriceForCart()) that is queueable but Salesforce cannot go with it for now due to certain challenges in error handling


Impact: Although the async pricing API solves the purpose of not running into governor limits, this is not creating a good user experience. It creates a lot of ambiguity.


Ask: Having a configurable option to turn off/on the emails completely so that customers can have their own customized emails with relevant content in the email body.

title: Highlight of invalid discount values
author: Raj Poshiya
content: In the cart, the discounts which are provided should be highlighted if they are invalid. Invalid means for example negative discounts or discounts which are higher than 100 %. These discounts could be e.g. highlighted in red on the corresponding line item. 1. Discounting in Summary Panel 2. Negative discount and large amount discount from line value. Want to see all the option available in Conga and option to prevent.

comments.content: The use case could be achieved today using deal guidance, where deal guidance could be set for below zero or above 100 with some band in red color. The slight difference would be instead of showing discounts in different colors, the additional column will be added with a color band.

title: Ability to define currency rounding modes per flow or currency basis
author: Chetan Patel
content:
Hi team,

Gartner customer is looking for a way to facilitate currency fields rounding mode per country/currency/flow basis. Currently we only have it at org level in the custom setting.

When customer has multi currency enabled in salesforce org, there are valid scenarios when customer needs to define rounding modes differently for each currency based on each country's norms. For example, for USD customer might want to keep HALF_EVEN whereas for JPY they would like to keep it different.

If we can facilitate out of the box way to define rounding modes per flow/currency basis by any means of configuration or providing a callback hook for customers to implement their own rounding logic for each flow/currency then it that would be great addition to multi currency features support by Conga.

So the feature reuirement is in case of any chanhge on the price matrics Or price rules the product version should change automatically by OOTB from 1 to 2 OR 2 to 3. So that on the revalidate Price changed in the Price Matrix will now be reflected in the cart. So they can use the below functionality. https://documentation.conga.com/cpq/may-22/revalidating-the-product-configuration-181307550.html This can be done by writing the custom logic in the Revalidation callback class, where the Pricing Status will be updated based on the Product Version change.

title: Promotion code should not get applied to non eligible lines
author: Swapnil Devlekar
content:
When we have products in the shopping cart that are eligible for promotion and we bulk select the line items which would include products that are eligible for promotion and some that are not, and apply the promotions in bulk, the system applies the promotion code to all non-eligible lines as well. The adjustment is applied only to the eligible lines.


This is misleading to users as non-eligible lines also get the promotion applied.


Like adjustment the promotion code should also be applied only to the eligible items.

title: Allow/display discounts on negative prices
author: Maurice Hout
content:
Use Case:
For SimCorp, discounts are applied at quote summary level. This is used in combination with an approval workflow on both discount approvals and deal size approvals. Simcorp has some use cases, where named users are allowed to enter a pre-approved adjustment (controlled through collaboration.) The most important one is when converting existing clients from a perpetual contract to a subscription contract, so it is not an inferior case. It is part of contract transformations. The sales rep may want to apply an additional discount on the quote as is – or maybe there is upselling and discount as part of the conversion. The only way the sales rep can do the discounting is through the quote summary and it is paramount, that the discounting happens consistently across the quote. As negative prices are allowed and as discounts through the quote summary are supported, we expected the value to populate the "Net Adjustment Percent" field when -ve is applied. With -ve the field value is Null.
See attached screenshot where 20% discount was already applied. It doesn't show (right lower corner value .0,00% even when 20% was applied) This is confusing for the End Uses.
